description.raw:
Added the ability to load X3 with four sensor configurations:

1. QVGA camera \+ IMU
2. HG camera \+ IMU
3. QVGA RGBD camera \+ IMU
4. VGA RGBD camera \+ IMU

For testing, use `X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`, `X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_2`, `X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_3` or `X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_4` environment variables. Here’s an example:

    roslaunch subt_gazebo competition.launch scenario:=tunnel_practice_2
    X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_3=1 X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1=1 X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_3=1 roslaunch subt_example team.launch

I’ve also included two separate rviz launch files:

\(Option 1: X3 equipped with a camera\)

    roslaunch subt_example x3_camera_rviz.launch

\(Option 2: X3 equipped with a depth camera\)

    roslaunch subt_example x3_rgbd_rviz.launch

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3201157895-x3_camera.png)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/1332165270-x3_rgbd.png)
_Note: This pull request is built atop of pull request #62, which should be merged first._
description.html:
Added the ability to load X3 with four sensor configurations:

  1. QVGA camera + IMU
  2. HG camera + IMU
  3. QVGA RGBD camera + IMU
  4. VGA RGBD camera + IMU

For testing, use X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1, X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_2, X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_3 or X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_4 environment variables. Here’s an example:

roslaunch subt_gazebo competition.launch scenario:=tunnel_practice_2
X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_3=1 X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1=1 X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_3=1 roslaunch subt_example team.launch

I’ve also included two separate rviz launch files:

(Option 1: X3 equipped with a camera)

roslaunch subt_example x3_camera_rviz.launch

(Option 2: X3 equipped with a depth camera)

roslaunch subt_example x3_rgbd_rviz.launch

‌

Note: This pull request is built atop of pull request #62, which should be merged first.

title: Sensor configurations for X3
